meanings.definition: Cower: to crouch down in fear
meanings.sent1: The little puppy would cower when it heard thunder.
meanings.sent2: During the scary movie, the character would cower in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The kitten would cower playfully when chasing a toy.
meanings.sent4: The flowers seemed to cower under the heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The child's face showed pure terror as he began to cower.

meanings.definition: Cower: to show fear by trembling or shrinking
meanings.sent1: The mouse would cower in the corner whenever the cat approached.
meanings.sent2: The hiker would cower when he heard a loud noise in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The student would cower jokingly when the teacher pretended to be angry.
meanings.sent4: The old house seemed to cower under the weight of time.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds made the birds cower in their nests.
